docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg testified at a state legislative budget hearing on Monday, criticizing the Spitzer administration for reneging on its promises and shortchanging New York City by about $500 million, according to an article by Trymaine Lee. "A deal is a deal," the mayor argued. "This year, as we do every year, we've made budget decisions in the city based on the expectation, and even the expressed assurances, that Albany will honor its commitments to us."
docs.abstract: Also in Morning Buzz: The M.T.A. overruns may limit the Second Avenue Line and a transit center, and a sticky-fingered state librarian sells items on eBay.
